Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] Seminar: Machine Learning and Data Management Systems

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Room announcement of the final presentations

Messages.Author: Dennis Grinwald
Messages.Content: Dear all,  The room for the final presentations will be MAR 4.033. The order of your presentations will be the same as listed in the Presentation Dates document. Since we want to start at 1 pm sharp on both dates, please be there a bit before. If you have further questions feel free to reach out.  Best regards, Dennis Grinwald

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Presentation date allocation and registration for the exam through MOSES

Messages.Author: Dennis Grinwald
Messages.Content: Dear students,  you can find your final presentation date allocation in the following document (Presentation dates). If you can't find your matriculate number under the corresponding date, or if you chose another date than the one that is listed in the document, don't hesitate to get in touch with me with your matriculate number and preferred presentation date.  Moreover, it is now possible to register for the exam through MOSES. Two exam options are listed, one for the 19th and one for the 25th of July, respectively. Please make sure to register for the one that was allocated to you.  Feel free to reach out, if you have any further questions.  Kind regards, Dennis Grinwald

Messages.Author: Dennis Grinwald
Messages.Content: Dear all,  we have decided on the dates for your paper presentations. There will be the two following presentation dates:  July 19th and July 25th, from 1 p.m. - 4 p.m. for both dates. The exact room for the presentations will be announced in advance. Each student must participate in at least one of the two dates. Please let us know on which of the two dates you would like to present. If you can present at either, please let us know as this would facilitate the creation of the exact presentation schedule. Of course, you can participate in both events, one as speaker and the other one as part of the audience. If you decide not to take part in the seminar, please let us know, as this would facilitate our work. Moreover, not every student has yet informed me about their matriculate number. Please do so. Additionally, I kindly ask you to tell me whether you are taking the seminar as a standalone, or as an elective for another module (please share the module name).   Best regards, Dennis Grinwald

Messages.Author: Dennis Grinwald
Messages.Content: Dear all,  We have uploaded a document (Paper Assignments) with the final paper assignment for each of you, except for two students for whom a different paper must be chosen due to a conflict of wishes. I have already contacted the relevant students. If you are not on the list and have not been contacted yet, please reach out to me. Moreover, several students have not yet shared their matriculation numbers with us. Please do so. If you need help understanding your paper, please let us know so we can assign you a supervisor from our groups. We will plan a schedule for your final paper presentations and will let you know once we have decided on a schedule.  Best regards, Dennis Grinwald

Messages.Author: Dennis Grinwald
Messages.Content: Dear all, we have just uploaded the slides from yesterday's Kick-Off meeting. Since more people than in the last semesters joined yesterday, we have extended the paper list.  Please let us know by May 23rd, which paper you would like to choose. You will find our contacts in the slides. If there are no clashes, we will confirm your paper selection and share the contact information for your assigned supervisors on May 24th. Otherwise, we will get back to you to find another paper you can present.
